Package analysis

analysis package: a package implementing parallel algorithms for numerical differentiation and integration, and also including more complex transformations such as convolution.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
ConvolutionApproximator approximates the convolution operator between two functions f and g, defined as $$(f*g)(S) = \int_{-\infinity}^{+\infinity}f(S-x)g(x)dx$$.
FixedPointApproximatorMT computes a Fixed-Point of a contraction mapping f:R^n -> R^n, using multiple threads.
GradApproximator The class implements the Richardson extrapolation method to evaluate the derivative of a differentiable function.
GradApproximatorMT The class implements a multi-threaded version of the Richardson extrapolation method to evaluate the derivative of a differentiable function (serial version implemented in GradApproximator class of this package).
IntegralApproximator Performs numerical integration in one dimension using the Adaptive Simpson Procedure.
IntegralApproximatorMT Performs parallel numerical integration in one dimension using the Adaptive Simpson Procedure.
LinearOpFunction implements the linear operator T(x)=Ax+b.
 

Exception Summary
IntegrationException exception class for the analysis package.
 

Package analysis Description

analysis package: a package implementing parallel algorithms for numerical differentiation and integration, and also including more complex transformations such as convolution.
